item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 17, 2024 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. AlphaProof's Greatest Hits: the coolest bits from the IMO 2024 solutions (93 points | 34 comments)
2. Everything Is Just Functions: Mind-Blowing Insights from SICP and David Beazley (228 points | 123 comments)
3. Voyager 1 Breaks Its Silence with NASA via Radio Transmitter Not Used Since 1981 (138 points | 95 comments)

5. Creating a QR Code step by step (40 points | 5 comments)

7. Why did Windows 95 setup use three operating systems? (66 points | 20 comments)
8. Good Software Development Habits (185 points | 92 comments)
9. ML in Go with a Python Sidecar (53 points | 6 comments)

11. Bpftune uses BPF to auto-tune Linux systems (181 points | 48 comments)
12. Garak, LLM Vulnerability Scanner (112 points | 31 comments)

21. Japan ranked 31st in digital competitiveness, 92nd for English skills (62 points | 46 comments)
22. Apple's mouse is so bad that Tim Cook prefers using a different brand for work (32 points | 36 comments)
23. Show HN: Store and render ASCII diagrams in Obsidian (4 points | discuss)

25. Two Nobel Prize winners want to cancel their own CRISPR patents in Europe (131 points | 100 comments)
26. How to setup self hosted wiki for your startup (90 points | 43 comments)
27. Transistor for fuzzy logic hardware: promise for better edge computing (16 points | 3 comments)
28. Lucid dreaming app triples users' awareness in dreams, study finds (52 points | 29 comments)
29. The myth that you can’t build interactive web apps except as single page app (154 points | 83 comments)
30. Battery-Free Bioelectronic Implants (28 points | 8 comments)
